title: Jack Hammer Sound - Bad Seal
text:
I've been purchasing this filter for the past several years and have never had any issues until this past purchase. I installed the new filter and ran a few gallons of water as directed with no issues. The next day the fridge started making a loud noise when dispensing water. I had to eject the filter and push it back in to get it to work. Not a viable solution. It was like the O-Rings were not sealing and sucking air into the line. I had already thrown the old one away, so I couldn't put that one back in or use the O-Rings from the old one. My work-around was to use plumbers (Teflon) tape around the two O-Rings. 3 or 4 layers. My advice. Keep your old one for a few day in case you have issues. Like I said before, I've never had and issue with these before and in my experience is uncommon.

UPDATE: It seems the O-Rings were NOT the problem. It worked for a day or so but the issue (jack hammer sound) came back. However, I did find this solution by searching on the internet: Whirlpool switched from the purple PUR filters to the new Everydrop filters which have a slight difference in the length of the filters. These are about 1/16 " shorter. (I couldn't verify this claim though as I do not have an old PUR filter to compare with). The filter door is causing the filter to not seat all the way into the filter housing for a tight seal. I folded a paper towel up into a square and put it between the back of the filter and the door and that seated it securely. Hopefully this will be a better solution.

title: This filter is what you receive from Factory.
text: Please read installation Manual for your specific model. {read the whole thing} don't gloss over areas because if you do. you may create a real problem. Once you have full understanding it's a snap. On the bottom of the filter are arrows. Make sure you have it facing the right direction. When you slip filter in it has slot that must line up properly. and the door that is open has a assist piece that helps when you close the door to put the filter in firmly. The door will have seated the filter in place. You will air being perged though the filter. Where the water fill spout is in front. Fill a container until you have run 3 gallons threw the system. Your Filter is ready for another six months. And you will have good pressure.

title: Quality issues in the past 6 mos
text:
I've been using these in our fridge for years with no issue. I was due for a replacement in Oct 22 and ordered another. It would pass water at a level just above a trickle. I uninstalled, reinstalled, let the water run, etc. No luck, so I exchanged it.
The next one was the exact same. Figured there was a bad batch at my local Amazon hub, so I waited to hopefully let it cycle through. Got a new one again in Jan. While its slightly better, its still passing water at half the rate these typically did. Its far too slow to be practical, I fell back to using the sink most of the time.

title: Does not last. Slows water
text:
This filter should last 6 months. It might, but I have to replace it because it slows the water flow so much. I’ve bought 3 since they moved to this “one” monopoly. After 3 weeks, it takes 5 min to fill a large glass. After 2 months, 10 min. I have to schedule 20 min of my morning to fill two water bottles for the day. We don't live in an area with filthy water. We live in basically the suburbs so it’s not that our water is so bad it clogs this filter. It’s so expensive to waste so much time. I’ve never made it to the replacement date because it’s a trickle by 4 months.
I didn’t buy this filter here, but I feel people need to know what a waste this is. It’s the same filter at Walmart.

title: Noticeably Better Water
text:
When we moved into our new home, we got a Whirlpool side-by-side fridge with an exterior water and ice dispenser. We drink a lot of water and use our fridge water as our exclusive drinking water source from home. We noticed that around 4.5 months of use, the included filter was ready to be replaced.

We replaced with this filter and followed all the instructions regarding discarding the first two gallons.

Following our filter replacement, our water tastes great again! For our household we’ll replace a little earlier than biannually to filter best for our needs.

title: This was a very easy installation - Less than 60 seconds :-)
text:
We noticed the water pressure in our fairly new Whirlpool Refrigerator became very week. I learned the water filter possibly needed to be changed - it's been over 1 year since we purchased the new kitchen appliance.

Once I installed the Whirlpool Ice and Water Refrigerator Filter 1, EDR1RXD1, Single-Pack , Purple.. the water pressure was restored to normal. I then learn the filter should be changed at least twice a year..... Who knew..... ? :-)

title: The only one that worked for me
text:
I went through about six different water filters from various brands trying to find one that would work for my four year old Kenmore refrigerator on my last refill. Up until that point I had been successful using 3rd party filters. This time there was a change in the design for the filters by all manufacturers. Each one would fit fine but I could not get any pressure at all, just a hammering sound. This official Whirlpool filter worked right away, producing better water flow than I have gotten with any of the other filter manufacturers. I didn't notice any difference in the taste of the water. The filter was troublesome after the first night and I had to adjust it a few more times before it was just right to keep the water flowing. No problems in the month since.

I knocked one point off since it is a little pricey.

title: Do not buy this
text:
This filter does nothing.

Using a PPM counter, there is absolutely no change between water from the tap and water that’s come through this filter.

How is it filtering anything if the numbers are the same?

My water pitcher brings it down to zero.

I live in a newly built high rise. My fridge, the pipes, and all of the plumbing fixtures are brand new. My water isn’t very hard to begin with. Its another story for people in older homes where lead pipes and an old water heater aren’t good for water. but every public water system has some bacteria in it coming out of your tap.

It’s usually not a big deal, until we find out afterwards that people got sick

I’ve tested 3 filters, there was no change except for when I used a generic brand, it did slightly more than these.

I don’t see how the NSF tests are at all accurate.

title: Great filter but expensive
text:
The title says it all.

The filter was easy to install and seems to be effective at removing impurities. In my area, the tap water us fine and tastes good. The filter's main purpose is to allow the refrigerator to produce ice. The output water from the filter and the ice tastes great but I have a hard time justifying why I am spending so much for these filters.

My only complaint is that dropping nearly $100/year just to keep an ice machine working for a family of three seems excessive. I may start changing the filter once a year instead of twice. Other than the price, these are the best filters available for my fridge model.

title: The Filter Works Flawlessly for Six Months
text: I've used these filters in my KitchenAid refrigerator for the last couple of years, and to test their efficiency, I've used a hand-held meter to periodically check total dissolved solids (TDS) in water from the refrigerator water dispenser. Throughout the recommended six month intervals of use, the filters maintain clean, good tasting water, with low TDS content. They're easy to remove and install, and the price is quite reasonable.

title: Correct product for my Whirlpool fridge
text: After checking several alternatives for my fridge's water filtration system, this product, as found on Amazon, seemed to really best fit the manufacturer's standards. The filter arrived well-packaged and on time. Was very easy to install. I followed the instructions for flushing water through the installed filter before using for drinking. That took a long time and I'm not sure if that large quantity was really necessary. Water flow is a little below what they state, but perhaps my city pressure is a bit low. Water looks and tastes great, just like the original filter. As most reviewers say, these filters are fairly expensive and add up over the life of the fridge.

title: Second Filter to Only Last 1 Month
text:
This is the second of these filters in a row that lasted just over one month - even with low-to-moderate use and clean city water.

I've been using the same model of filter for the last two years and have never had a problem until now. (None had simply quit working like these last two.) The other in-line water filters in my home are fine and there hasn't been any work done on the water main that would have introduced contaminants.

I contacted Whirlpool/EveryDrop and they say they only have a 90-day warranty if bought from them directly and would not be able to help here. So, if you want to take a chance on this filter with possible QC issues, I'd recommend buying from them direct. As for me, I'll be installing a whole-house water filter because at this rate it'd pay for itself in less than a year.

title: The Price of Turning Off The Red Change Filter Light
text: When you buy a Whirlpool refrigerator, it’s kind of like buying an inkjet printer, in that, eventually, a little light will come on and indicate that you need to insert money into the device to get the little light to turn off again. “Oh, phooey, you are such a curmudgeon!” you might say, and you may be right. “Just press the little switch and the light will reset!” the clever amongst you may say, and you would be correct. Sure, you can do that. Not complain. Not speak up. Just kick that can down the road. Sure! BUT I AM NOT THE US CONGRESS. I WILL fix this problem correctly, no matter the cost. No matter the effort. No matter the danger. No matter the futility. Why, you may ask? Because I fill my dog’s water dish from the fridge’s water dispenser, and he will have the best. Even if it’s $40 every 6 months. Pros: filters water. Turns off annoying lights without leaving one with a sense of a job half-done. Cons: pricey. Feels somewhat unnecessary in this day and age of water treatment plants.

title: So far so good
text: I’ve only had it for two days so far. First time I’ve had a fridge with a water dispenser so I’ve never dealt with this before. Like most folks, The price was killing me. I looked at a few of the off brand filters, but after reading up on them and factoring the possibilities of fakes or them just not being as good of quality I decided to bite the bullet and go with this one. Plus every stinking fridge filter list has this brand at the top. That being said, I don’t understand the science behind running FOUR GALLONS of water through a filter before using it. After spending $55 on a filter the last thing I wanted to do was waste a bit of its life by pouring it down the drain. So, in protest I only ran three gallons through…so if I die we’ll know why lol. All jokes aside I do think this makes our life easier…no bottled water everywhere or gallon jugs in the fridge. No constantly filling up a zero water pitcher. I only hope the life span is as advertised…we will see.

title: Issues with installation
text:
Being the official filter replacement for my whirlpool fridge, I expected the installation to be seamless and quick transition from replacing an old filter to a new one.
However upon removing the old one and placing this one, I noticed a distinctive hammering noise, followed by sputtering of the water and then absolutely no flow. I tried everything a normal person would and nothing seemed to fixed the issue.
Now had this been some 3rd party filter for use with my fridge, I would have accepted reality that it might not have been made perfectly, however this is the official replacement part by the company.
I did my due delligence and made sure it was the right replacement filter, and that it looked exactly like the one before. Yet this seemed not to be the case as after all my fiddling, I was finally able to find the solution amongst the reviews here. Seems as though the new filter was made a 1/16 inch smaller than the old one, for whatever reason who knows. So I stuffed a bit of paper towel in the hatch, and it worked. Now for how long this temporary solution will last, who knows?
Again I would have expected this had this been a 3rd party replacement, but for the official thing, this is simply unacceptable, rather outrageous.
The filter is already expensive, and on top of that, there is issues installing it in the fridges it was MADE for?
And it has not only affected me but tons of other customers too. I expected better from Whirlpool or however makes this filter.

title: The filter does not work- I checked it with my new Zero Water Filter gauge
text:
I order from Amazon for convenience. The last filter I ordered quit working after 3 months and my indicator light to change the filter had not turned yellow or red yet on my Whirlpool fridge. My fridge is just over a year old, and even after the replacing with a second filter (this same one from Amazon) my icemaker was not working. After much trial and error-I was able to get the icemaker to work again. I tested the water from this newly installed filter ( after letting several gallons run through first to dislodge any sediments) and the ppm reading tested almost the same as my tap water!!!
I used my new Zero Water Pitcher test gauge for the comparison. I also let some ice from the fridge melt and tested it and the result was the same.
I am not able to tell if this product is bogus- but my son is a Home Depot Manager and I am going to buy a filter from him and compare the packaging to the one other new packaged product that I got from Amazon. Rest assured- I will be contacting Amazon customer service and Whirlpool if I find any discrepancies.

title: BUY YOUR FILTERS AT YOUR LOCAL HARDWARE STORE INSTEAD
text: This filter is defective.  After installing this filter our water started tasting like rubber and plastic.  We had a Whirlpool tech come out thinking that there was something wrong with our water line.  This was not the case.  He checked our filter and said that it is known that filters that have been kept shelved before selling can "go bad".  He sees it quite often when people order through the internet to save a few dollars.  We removed the filter and went out and bought another $49 filter and inserted it.  The water is now being filtered correctly and through a "working" filter.  Buyer beware.  Maybe ordering through Amazon is not the way to go  Just go to your local Lowes/Home Depot and purchase one.  Can't return it because the window for returning already passed us by unfortunately.

text: Purchased this filter twice in the past and each time it only lasted 2 months. I decided to order another filter anyway since I couldn't decide on another filter to try. I installed the new filter around 8pm. When I opened my refrigerator around an hour later, there was water EVERYWHERE! My husband thought I might have installed it wrong so he went and opened the little filter door and when he did, the filter SHOT OUT at him, along with a massive amount of water. I am NEVER ordering this filter again. Such a waste of money. It claims it lasts for 6 months but you're lucky if you can get 2 month out of it.

text: I bought one of these last year and had an issue where after a few months the water stream would come out slow and thin. I bought a generic and it worked fine. After my six months were up I once again bought one of these Whirlpool filters this year and after three months I had the same issue again. I don't know if it's Amazon's inventory or the brand.

title: Didn't work at all for me
text: Ordered and installed this Every Drop model on my Whirlpool fridge, and noticed that the water ran much faster out of the dispenser vs with previous filters (as if it was not being filtered). Amazon website did say that this model allows for greater flow of water and reduces more contaminants vs the Pur model, which is why I got it, but the pressure seemed to aggressive. The dispenser also made much more noise with this filter when getting water. The kicker for me was the taste--the water from the fridge (with the filter in place) was no better than the tap. I tried reseating the filter a few times and gave it a few weeks to see if it would get better, and it did not. Replaced it with the Pur model that I was accustomed to using, and things got instantly better--pressure was lower (appeared indicative of being filter vs running free/unfiltered), noise was gone, and taste was much better. Went back and checked the place of manufacture for each unit: Every Drop is made in Antigua and Barbuda (Amazon website misspells "polypropolene" btw); Pur is made in USA. Too late for me to return it; was a waste of $50.

text: Purchased 2 of these filters.  Neither filter would work in my refrigerator.  Ended up putting my old filter back in. Contacted Everydrop to explain my problem. title: Potentially dangerous and misleading product
text:
I have tested the last 2 filters one near end of life and a brand new one after flush and the TDS count is almost negligibly better by 20 on a brand new filter after a proper 4 gallon flush (I continued on to flush 6 gallons for good measure). The old filter measured the same TDS as the water coming directly out of the tap and that filter is being replaced within its 6 month lifespan and is not heavily used. How is this even considered filtration?! My tap water measures at 490-500 which is awful and not drinkable. This filter did NOTHING to make that water any more drinkable. For a nearly $50 filter I expect more than close to NOTHING in performance. I expect at least a small yet measurable difference but the difference I see on the new filter (even after 6 gallons) is still 480 tds when my tap is 490.

Everyone BEWARE if you have high tds water this filter is absolutely insufficient trash and you should not rely on it to perform any kind of filtration function in the name of your health. This filter is merely decorative subscription trash to the refrigerator you purchased and has no functional value.

If you do not believe me, buy a $10-15 TDS monitor and test it yourself, for your healths sake. Especially if you are depending on the water this filter produces to be safe to drink.

I am not selling anything but am just shocked to finally test this water myself and now I need to find a new safe solution for a constant supply of drinking water in my home.

title: There aren't good alternatives unfortunately
text:
I don't pay almost 50 bucks for a filter to still have sediment floating in the water after running a few pitchers through it. The older filters I never had an issue with. I threw away the box it came in as soon as it got here naively expecting it to work. So no return!

There aren't good alternatives unfortunately. All I can say is, buy a pack so you might get 1 that works.

title: Horrible Chemical Tastes
text: I didn't purchase from this seller but I felt writing this review might help others to see the problem is more widespread. I'm starting to wonder if EveryDrop has done something different.  I have always purchased my Every Drop filter from Lowes and have never had a problem but this time I decided to pick one up from Home Depot since it's closer to my house.  Well I had to replace it after 2 months of use because the water had a horrible chemical taste.  I took it back to Home Depot and received a refund, and went ahead and purchased another one thinking maybe I had bought a bad one.  Unfortunately, that one was horrible as well even after flushing a couple of gallons and emptying the ice container several times.  That chemical is very unhealthy, and as soon as anyone detects a small amount in their ice, get rid of the filter.  Anyway, I posted to say this is a problem with Every Drop filters obviously because I'm reading reviews that describe my situation and I didn't purchase from this seller, but bought mines at Home Depot.  I'm going to return this 2nd filter and head over to Lowes and pray I receive a good filter or maybe an offbrand.... anything is better than this harmful chemical in our water.

title: Dont buy from whirlpool, faulty products they won't replace
text: I did not purchase this from Amazon but I am forewarning customers now to buy from whirlpool at all! I was in desperate need of a refrigerator. My grandmother was nice enough to help me buy one from home depot, was a whirlpool.. Now it stopped working after 2 days. Their protocol for items that break is they refuse to replace and will constantly send technicians out to try to fix them even after 100x of no luck with fixing they still will not replace. They will do absolutely nothing. I am a single mom and this refrigerator has wasted $100's in food leaving me devistated! Now I Can't feed my baby all thanks to whirlpool. Also when I told them about this they showed 0 concern just got nasty with me. We paid $1,000 for this refrigerator barly have had it a few weeks now even though it didn't work starting 2 days after it arrived from home depot. They have treated me and others so poorly as well as taking advantage of a woman amongst other things! So buyer beware! Especially if you are a woman. There has been a technician here almost every week since it has been purchased and they still refuse to replace it. They do not care about their customers at all do not buy their products save yourself the headache. Do you really want something from a company that does not replace a product if you were to receive a lemon?

title: Expensive useless filter lasts one month.
text:
2nd replacement filter I have bought. First one lasted 4 months before the water flow was so bad it would probably be faster to drive to my parents house and back to fill a glass.

The 3rd filter I have bought has not even lasted more than a month with the same results. Original filter with the refrigerator lasted the suggested 6 months and we have not changed our water usage habits.

This leads to one of three conclusions:
1. The replacement filters are a scam designed to not last for extra cash.
2. Amazon is selling faulty defective filters.
3. These are horrible filters.

Either way this will be the last Whirlpool refrigerator I will ever buy and am already regretting not getting the LG I was deciding between.

Buyer beware these filters are not worth the money.

[Edit: bought a large under the sink filter and I am going to stop using these altogether.]

title: Lasted less than a month
text:
Received a genuine product that was sold by and fulfilled by Amazon and installed it a little under three weeks ago. It was great for about two weeks and then slowly started getting the chlorine taste back from the city water.

The original, seemingly identical, filter last almost five months. We don't have excessively chlorinated water like some parts of the country so I'm not sure why this filters life was so short compared to the one that came in the refrigerator. In a household of only two people, I would expect a lot longer life out of a filter that is supposed to be replaced every six months and costs so much.

Ordering a replacement now to see if it was a fluke and I managed to get one that was improperly made. Will update my review if there's an improvement.

title: Bought 2 of these and neither worked as advertised
text: When the original W10295370 filter expired, we bought the new Everydrop replacement  from Whirlpool.  The water tasted horrible with the new filter.  We replaced the reservoir in the refrigerator and the supply line as well.  Still tasted bad.  Couldn't return the bad filter because 30 days went past (It took time to get the plumber out here and to order the parts).  So, I ordered another one thinking I did everything on my end so it must have been a rogue filter.  That one came and I installed and flushed and used it for about 2 weeks.  The water tastes horrible.  I returned that one right away.  There must be a problem with the newly branded Everydrop because the old blue filters worked just fine.  I'm out the cost of a filter, a plumber and parts.  I'm going to try and find the older Blue Filter to see if maybe when Whirlpool switched to Everydrop, there was some manufacturing problems with these newer ones.

title: Filters DO NOT work in some older fridge models
text: Contrary to vendor website and Amazon listing, this unit NO LONGER works in all "supported" models, e.g. WRS325FDAM02.  Believe the people reporting this in the comments, which I did not read in advance.  I tried three filters in total, as well as another higher priced one from the local "big box" store.  All four made in the Taiwan facility.  All four with filter activation arms or body profiles seemingly inconsistent with the older, same model filter they were replacing.  Hours or flushing, bleeding, etc. and only a trickle of water compared to the used filter unless unnatural pressure was placed against the filter to push it far enough to activate the bypass valve cutoff, but inhuman amounts that the filter latch cannot maintain.  May work with newer model fridge.  Guess I will be looking for an aftermarket filter since the "better" filters aren't better if it can't flow.

title: Works fine, no recycling program
text: I've used these for the past couple of years with my Ikea fridge and the water tastes fine. My major gripe is that the only way to get rid of an old one is to dispose of it in the landfill. I emailed the manufacturer, and they pointed out that the plastic casing is recyclable. However, given that the filters are filled with some kind of charcoal or sand, my municipal recycling agency would not be very happy to receive it. There appears to be no way to open it up to discard the contents and their customer service rep had no suggestions. As of this writing, I could not find a single manufacturer that will recycle refrigerator water filters, so I guess this review applies to refrigerator water filters in general. Bummer.

title: Chlorine + plastic flavor after 3 months (our city cycled free chlorine)
text:
Our city recently switched to free chlorine for a month, then back to the less volatile chloramine. I read that this is a standard practice that many cities take once a year.

By the end of the process, the filtered water tasted like pool water with a plastic flavor. The filter is supposed to protect against chlorine and chloramine, but this says otherwise :(. Flavor is very intense and can't be healthy. I will be throwing away the filter and buying one from a local store after reading some other reviews.

I might soon just switch to RO system, since $50 several times a year is pretty expensive.

title: There was no change in water quality 269 PPM down to 243 PPM
text:
I testes this water filter to see if it was working. I used the test stick that came with my ZERO water pitcher. So, I tested the water from the TAP. 269 PPM than I tested the water through the refrigerator water filter PPM was only 243 only a change of 10 PPM (PARTICLES PER MILLION). So, I ran 2 gallons of water through the water system in the refrigerator thinking maybe it needs a break in period. Mind you the family has been using the new filter through the refrigerator for about a week now. Still only 243 PPM. Thank I took the same water from the refrigerator and ran it through the ZERO water filter, and you know what the test stick came back with 000 PPM.
So, this filter is a total scam. I don’t think most will go fare to test to see if the filter is working like I did. But for $45 I needed to make sure it works. But it failed miserably. I would have been happy if it came back with 150 PPM, but only a 23-point change heck no. I sent it back. TO bad Zero water doesn't make a refrigerator water filter..

text: This product does not filter the water at all! I have flushed over 10 gallons of water and the levels are still high and the same as before I put the new filter. Such a rip off!

title: Great product
text: The filter works great every time. I wished they were built to last longer!!

title: Buyer Beware
text: Did not receive the product as described, but a generic water filter 1 instead.

title: It works
text: so far so good

title: Not working
text: The product stopped working after three months, i want to replace the product.

title: Know the model number of the refrigerator in which you are replacing the filter.
text: It matched the filter that came from Whirlpool, but more reasonably priced.

title: It works
text: Expensive but it is the original filter for Whirlpool and very easy to install.  Works great.

title: Filter...
text: It was delivered on time and was what I needed.

title: Filter keeps popping out
text: I purchased this for the second time. The first one I received worked perfectly, no issues. The second one now was hard to install and wouldn’t stay in. Now it just keeps popping out and spraying water everywhere in the fridge. It has been confirmed it is the correct one and that it was correctly installed by a technician. I’ve researched this issue and it seems to be a bad filter.
